content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::Markdown.MD)
    # Initialize an empty string to hold the extracted Julia code
    extracted_code = ""

    # Iterate over all child blocks of the markdown document
    for i in 1:length(md.content)
        # If a block is a code fence, and the language is Julia
        if Markdown.is_code(md.content[i]) && md.content[i].code.mime == "text/plain"
            # Remove the code fences (start and end lines)
            code = replace(string(md.content[i].code), r"^```julia\n|```$" => "")
            # Append the code to the extracted string, with a newline if not the first block
            if i > 1
                code = "\n" * code
            end
            extracted_code = extracted_code * code
        end
    end

    return extracted_code
end
```
